sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: What’s new in Chrome, Edge, Safari and Firefox? Patrick Brosset breaks it down with the latest features in DevTools across browsers.
articles.title: What’s New In DevTools?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Eckles)
articles.description: Cascade layers introduce the new at-rule of @layer. The intent is to help CSS authors be more intentional about ordering the “layers” of CSS rules as a new method of cascade management.
articles.title: Getting Started With CSS Cascade Layers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Javier Cuello)
articles.description: Joining a team where there are no established design practices may feel disheartening. Does this situation resonate with you? If yes, then read on — as this article is sharing the author’s advice based on his personal experience and it will show you a way (although not easy) of facing the problem in a manner that will bring other benefits, beside order and consistency.
articles.title: From Chaos To System In Design Teams

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Georgii Perepecho)
articles.description: In this article, Georgii Perepecho explains the most common React Query features that you need to be familiar with when creating a real-life application that is stable when testing.
articles.title: Building The Real App With React Query

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What goes into creating a successful design system? How can you take your testing workflow to the next level? And what smart interface design patterns could help you enhance your UIs? Let’s figure it out. With our [online workshops on front-end and UX](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops).
articles.title: Upcoming Online Workshops: January – May 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anton Tyschenko)
articles.description: Every once in a while, we publish [freebies](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/category/freebies) related to different occasions and themes. We hope that with this icon set, everyone will be able to find their own use case for these icons in particular. Today, we present to you three icon sets designed by the creative folks at GraphicSurf — all free for personal and commercial use.
articles.title: Freebie: Wayfinding Icon Sets (164 Icons, PNG, SVG, AI, EPS)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: We’ll explore fluid typography principles, use-cases, implementation with CSS clamp() and an interactive fluid typography calculator.
articles.title: Modern Fluid Typography Using CSS Clamp

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In [Part 1](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/01/ten-tips-aspiring-designer-beginners-part1/), Luis Ouriach shared advice he wished he had when starting out in his career. In this second and last part of this series, Luis continues sharing tips that helped him grow and become a better designer throughout the years.
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Don)
articles.description: If you’re a developer who’s thinking about building a platform that requires a code editor in one form or another, then this article is for you. This article explains how to create a web code editor that displays the result in real time with the help of some HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
articles.title: Building A Web Code Editor

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: Accessibility must be a permanent program within organizations, much like security. In this article, Kate Kalcevich shares tips on which skills and questions to keep in mind when hiring for digital accessibility roles.
articles.title: How To Hire For Digital Accessibility Roles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll be taking a closer look at two gradients: `conic-gradient` and `radial-gradient`. You’ll see how each one of them works in detail, what the differences and similarities are between them, how and where to use them, and some use cases for each.
articles.title: A Deep CSS Dive Into Radial And Conic Gradients

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: Product roadmaps are often treated as a series of checkboxes. But they are more than that. In this article, Scott Himmer explains how internal partnerships, research, design systems, and regular touch bases can help make sure that your product roadmap is a successful one.
articles.title: Changing A Tire On A Moving Car (Or How To Improve Product Roadmaps)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In this article (the first part in a series of two), Luis Ouriach shares advice that he wishes he has when starting out in his career. These tips come from his experience as a user interface and product designer for close to ten years, and if you’re starting just now, then read on!
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Aleksandra Nagornaia)
articles.description: Figma has advanced enough where it now supports some powerful concepts that can help with the flexibility and maintainability of a design system. In this article, Sasha explains why she finds the Systems Designer position so rewarding — and it’s not only because of how fast certain tools have developed to help her master challenges she faces in her work projects.
articles.title: Composition-Based Design System In Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What better way could there be to start the new year than with some fresh inspiration? Our collection of wallpapers for January 2022 is bound to put a smile on your face — and maybe spark new ideas, too.
articles.title: New Year, Fresh Desktop (January 2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Scoping, estimating, and running digital projects can often feel like an exercise in futility. In this article, Paul Boag explains why you need to start breaking your projects down into manageable phases and why that’s the best way to achieve significant benefits.
articles.title: How To Price Projects And Manage Scope Creep

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: If you're a Windows user, you've probably had your PC randomly shut down. This can be frustrating and negatively impact your productivity as it interrupts important tasks and activities. This random shutdown might be caused by software or hardware issues, or both on some occasions. I have researched 4 ways
articles.title: PC Randomly Turns Off – How to Fix Windows Computer Shutting Down

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: React is one of the most popular front-end JavaScript libraries for building user interfaces. Using TypeScript for your React projects can lead to a more robust codebase with less errors. We just published a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to use React with
articles.title: How to Code Your React App with TypeScript

articles.author: Sampurna Chapagain
articles.description: If you are a web developer or a web designer, it is essential for you to have a portfolio website. It lets you provide information about yourself and showcase your best work with your relevant skills and experience. In this blog post, I will discuss some of the benefits of
articles.title: How to Create a Portfolio Website Using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap 5

articles.author: Oluwatobi Sofela
articles.description: Temporal Dead Zone and Hoisting are two essential terms in JavaScript. But understanding how they work can easily confuse you if you don't approach them properly. But don't fret! This article is here to help you get a good grasp of the two terms. So relax, grab your favorite cup
articles.title: Temporal Dead Zone (TDZ) and Hoisting in JavaScript – Explained with Examples

articles.author: Dionysia Lemonaki
articles.description: In this article you'll see how to use Python's .replace() method to perform substring substiution. You'll also see how to perform case-insensitive substring substitution. Let's get started! What does the .replace() Python method do? When using the .replace() Python method, you are able to replace every instance of one specific
articles.title: Python String.Replace() – Function in Python for Substring Substitution

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: AutoCAD is a popular computer aided design software used to design and model in 2D and 3D. It is used by used by architects, engineers, designers, real estate developers, artists, and more. We just published a complete university AutoCAD course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. Gediminas Kirdeikis developed this course.
articles.title: Learn AutoCAD with This Free Course
